org.imaginea.test.automation.framework.driver

Class CacheDriverFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.imaginea.test.automation.framework.driver.CacheDriverFactory

  • public class CacheDriverFactory
extends Object
    CacheDriverFactory provides a utility for creating and maintaining Selenium WebDriver instance.

    Driver Creation

    The framework supports an in-build implementation of driver creation as well as provide the flexibility to allow user to provide his own driver implementation.

    In-build driver supports firefox,ie,chrome,htmlunit. Thes values can be set to the property test.name inside taf.properties file. For user defined driver, User have to implement a class implementing the IDriverProvider interface and add the path to the said class onto the property userdefined.driverclass inside taf.properties file.

    Driver Management

    The class provides two different implementation of driver factory:

    1. Simple Driver Instance - In this driver instance management mode the driver object will be same across all the threads.
    2. Threaded Driver Instance - In this driver instance management mode the driver will be different for each thread instance that is getting executed.
    By default "Simple Driver Instance" management is chosen by the framework. But in case you need a "Threaded Driver Instance" management you can configure it by setting property thread.based.driver to true inside taf.properties file.
    Author:
    Varun Menon

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CacheDriverFactory()
      Default Constructor which will create the CacheDriverFactory object and uses the default config class object.

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void clearCacheAndQuitDriver()
      Clears the current driver from the factory and then quits the said driver object
      org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver clearDriver()
      Clears the current driver from the factory and return the old driver back
      org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver getDriver()
      Create or return the current driver based on the configuration provided inside the taf.properties file.
      IDriverProvider getDriverProvider()
      Returns the driver provider to be used for the execution.
      boolean getThreadBasedDriver()
      Return true or false based on the condition whether the driver object is thread based or not
      IDriverProvider getUserDefinedDriverProvider()
      Returns the Driver Provider class object of the class that has been provided by the user for Driver creation
      void setThreadBasedDriver(boolean value)
      Sets the thread based driver configuration with the given value.

      • getDriverProvider

        public IDriverProvider getDriverProvider()
        Returns the driver provider to be used for the execution. In case a user defined driver provider is available the said class object is returned else it will return the InbuiltDriverProvider class instance.
        Returns:
        IDriverProvider object of the driver provider class.
